data.event: It is the 29th largest municipality in Illinois as measured by population in the 2010 US Census, and has easy access to downtown Chicago (the Chicago Loop) via public transportation including the CTA Blue and Green lines, buses, and Metra commuter rail.
It incorporated in 1902, breaking off from Cicero.
Famed architect Frank Lloyd Wright and his wife settled here in 1889.
In the 1960s, Oak Park faced the challenge of racial integration, devising many strategies to integrate rather than re-segregate the village, which so far are successful.
